basics.name: Harrison Gray
basics.label: Computer Science Student
basics.summary: I am pursuing a B.A. in Computer Science at the University of Hawaii at Manoa, with an expected graduation date of Spring 2027. My interests include game development, full-stack developmne, and entrepreneurship.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

work.summary: Worked on enterprise tax system development for the State of Hawaii Department of Taxation.
highlights: Engineered a new Payment Plan Request feature with detailed installment schedules and real-time payment tracking.
Developed backend features in C# and SQL, enhancing statewide payment processing capabilities.
Queried and analyzed databases to identify 8,000+ late tax return submissions.
Refactored 2,000+ lines of SQL and C# code, improving maintainability and reducing runtime errors.

work.summary: Built a full-stack web application to showcase Hawaii’s startup ecosystem.
highlights: Developed a dataset of 175+ companies and organizations into a responsive web app using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
Implemented Mapbox API for geospatial visualization with custom markers and interactive layers.
Collaborated with developers and presented the final application to accelerator leadership.

work.summary: Provided IT support for students, faculty, and campus systems.
highlights: Resolved hardware, software, and network issues while documenting recurring solutions.
Assisted with maintaining campus IT infrastructure including networks, servers, and classroom technology.

volunteer.summary: Support student development and networking in IT and management.
highlights: Organize career-focused events and professional interaction nights.
Connect students with industry leaders in Hawaii’s tech community.

volunteer.summary: Participate in programming, competitions, and professional development.

awards.title: Dean's Honor List
awards.summary: Recognized for academic excellence with a GPA of 3.5 or higher.
